description: Uncertain; perhaps from scum with frequentative -le.

entries.meaning: An opaque kind of glaze (layer of paint).

verbs.description: scumble (third-person singular simple present scumbles, present participle scumbling, simple past and past participle scumbled)

entries.meaning: To apply an opaque glaze to an area of a painting to make it softer or duller.
examples: "I want you to scumble the bottom third with sap green."
